definition: to nail securely/to execute by means of impalement/to crucify
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]

sentences.english: When I am free, I will take up my cross. I will crucify the pride in me.
sentences.chinese: 等出狱后，我要负起十字架，钉死我的骄傲。

sentences.english: Instantly, the girl employed her arouse to pin her oppfirstnt.
sentences.chinese: 女孩子立即用她那一招钉死了对手。

sentences.english: The police broke up the window nailed down and rescued the boy from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 警察打碎了用钉子钉死的窗子，救出了大火中的男孩。

sentences.english: Fable Jesus is nailed tight on the cross, after dying, third day of reactivating ascends to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 传说耶稣被钉死在十字架上，死后第三天复活升天。

sentences.english: Were you there when they crucified my Lord?
sentences.chinese: 他们钉死我主时，你在场吗？

sentences.english: Instantly, the girl used her move to pin her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 女孩立即用她那一招钉死了对手。

sentences.english: Mr. Dunlop, how would you like to nail The Blitz?
sentences.chinese: 邓洛普先生，你想不想钉死闪电？

sentences.english: On the crucifixion there's some differences.
sentences.chinese: 关于在十字架上钉死也有一些不同。

sentences.english: According to that tradition you can't crucify a Roman citizen.
sentences.chinese: 根据这个经典，罗马公民是不能被钉死在十字架上的。

sentences.english: Is not pity the cross on which he is nailed who loveth man?
sentences.chinese: 怜悯不就是那钉死爱人类者的十字架吗？

sentences.english: All the doors were nailed up.
Crucifixion was a cruel form of execution.
sentences.chinese: 把人钉死在十字架上是一种残忍的死刑方式。

sentences.english: And that is what Jesus Christ did for us on the cross.
sentences.chinese: 那就是耶稣基督为了我们的罪钉死在十字架上。

sentences.english: Thank You for dying on the cross for my sins.
sentences.chinese: 您钉死在十字架上为我赎罪，我万分感激。

sentences.english: Now Paul knows that the Romans crucified Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 保罗知道罗马人钉死了耶稣。

definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
